title: TRELLO-001: Initialize project structure
description: Create trello-mentoring-generator directory with standard Python project layout. Include README.md, requirements.txt (requests, python-dotenv), .env.example, src/ directory with __init__.py, and tests/ directory. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Create directory structure with src/, src/templates/, tests/ subdirectories, 2) Initialize requirements.txt with pinned dependency versions, 3) Create .env.example template with TRELLO_API_KEY and TRELLO_TOKEN placeholders, 4) Add .gitignore for .env, __pycache__, .pytest_cache. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Directory structure follows Python packaging best practices with no redundant paths. [CODE SMELLS] No placeholder or TODO comments in committed files. [ARCHITECTURE] Structure aligns with 12-factor app principles - config via environment, clear separation of concerns. [SECURITY] .env excluded from version control via .gitignore; .env.example contains only placeholder values, never real credentials; requirements.txt pins exact versions to prevent supply chain attacks. [PERFORMANCE] N/A for scaffolding task. [TESTING] Verify structure with: pytest --collect-only returns no errors; python -c 'from src import *' imports successfully.

title: TRELLO-002: Implement Trello REST API client
description: Create src/trello_client.py with TrelloClient class using requests library. Implement methods: create_board(name, description), create_list(board_id, name, position), create_card(list_id, name, description, labels), create_label(board_id, name, color), create_checklist(card_id, name), add_checklist_item(checklist_id, name). IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Implement TrelloClient class with auth via constructor injection, 2) Add CRUD methods for boards/lists/cards/labels/checklists, 3) Add error handling with custom exceptions, 4) Implement response validation and rate limit handling. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Each method must have cyclomatic complexity <= 5; no method exceeds 20 lines; extract common HTTP logic to private _request() method; eliminate any code duplication across CRUD methods. [CODE SMELLS] No bare except clauses; no magic strings (use constants); no mutable default arguments; all public methods have docstrings; run pylint/flake8 with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] Single responsibility - client only handles HTTP transport; no business logic; dependency injection for testability; consistent with existing project patterns. [SECURITY] Never log credentials; validate all API responses before processing; sanitize user inputs in request payloads; use HTTPS only; implement request timeout (30s max); no credential storage in class state beyond session lifetime. [PERFORMANCE] Use requests.Session for connection pooling; avoid redundant API calls; lazy initialization where appropriate; document any retry logic and its performance implications. [TESTING] Unit tests required: test each CRUD method with mocked responses; test error handling for 4xx/5xx responses; test rate limit handling; test timeout behavior; minimum 90% line coverage for this module; all tests must pass.

title: TRELLO-003: Define tech career template with dataclasses
description: Create src/templates/tech_career.py with dataclass definitions for BoardTemplate, ListDef, CardDef, LabelDef, ChecklistDef. Define TECH_CAREER_TEMPLATE constant with 4 Kanban lists (Backlog, In Progress, Review, Done), 6 mentoring cards (Resume Review, Interview Prep, Coding Practice, Portfolio Building, Networking, Goal Setting) with descriptions and checklists, and 6 labels (Priority High/Medium/Low, Type Skill/Career/Networking). IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Define frozen dataclasses for immutable template structure, 2) Create TECH_CAREER_TEMPLATE with all lists/cards/labels, 3) Add checklist items for each card, 4) Add __init__.py to templates directory exporting public API. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Dataclasses use frozen=True for immutability; no class exceeds 50 lines; extract repeated patterns into base classes or helper functions; use clear, descriptive field names; group related constants. [CODE SMELLS] No hardcoded strings without named constants; no deep nesting in data structures (max 3 levels); all dataclasses have type hints; no optional fields without explicit defaults; run pylint/flake8 with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] Pure data definitions only - no methods with side effects; template structure supports future extensibility without breaking changes; follows existing project dataclass patterns; single source of truth for template definitions. [SECURITY] No sensitive data in templates; validate that template content cannot be used for injection attacks; card descriptions are plain text only. [PERFORMANCE] Use tuple instead of list for immutable sequences; lazy loading not needed for static templates; template instantiation must be O(1). [TESTING] Unit tests required: test dataclass instantiation; test immutability (frozen); test template completeness (all required fields populated); test serialization if needed; all tests must pass.

title: TRELLO-004: Implement board generator orchestration
description: Create src/board_generator.py with BoardGenerator class that orchestrates template creation. Implement generate(template, board_name, description) method that: 1) Creates board via TrelloClient, 2) Creates all labels, 3) Creates lists in order, 4) Creates cards with descriptions and labels, 5) Creates checklists with items. Include dry-run mode that logs actions without API calls. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Implement BoardGenerator class with TrelloClient dependency injection, 2) Add generate() method with proper sequencing and error handling, 3) Add dry-run support with structured logging, 4) Return result object with created resource IDs and board URL. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Cyclomatic complexity of generate() must be <= 10; break into private methods for each resource type (_create_labels, _create_lists, _create_cards); no method exceeds 25 lines; eliminate duplication in resource creation loops; use early returns for error conditions. [CODE SMELLS] No nested try/except blocks deeper than 2 levels; no boolean flags controlling flow (use strategy pattern for dry-run); logging statements use structured format; no print() statements - use logging module; run pylint/flake8 with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] Orchestrator pattern - coordinates but does not implement API calls; transaction-like semantics - document partial failure behavior; follows dependency injection for TrelloClient; consistent error handling strategy across all methods; no circular dependencies. [SECURITY] Validate template content before API calls; sanitize board names and descriptions; log operations without exposing sensitive data; handle API errors without leaking internal state; fail securely on partial creation (document cleanup behavior). [PERFORMANCE] Minimize API calls - batch where Trello API supports; avoid creating resources that already exist; document expected API call count per board generation; no blocking I/O in loops without progress indication; dry-run must not make any network calls. [TESTING] Unit tests required: test full generation flow with mocked client; test dry-run produces no side effects; test partial failure handling; test with empty template; test with maximum-size template; minimum 90% line coverage; all tests must pass.

title: TRELLO-005: Create CLI entry point with argparse
description: Create generate_board.py CLI using argparse. Arguments: --name (required, board name), --description (optional, board description), --template (optional, default 'tech_career'), --dry-run (flag, preview without creating), --setup (flag, run credential setup), --verbose (flag, enable debug logging). Load environment variables from .env file. Use credentials module to validate before API calls. Print board URL on success. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Implement argparse CLI with all arguments and help text, 2) Integrate credentials.py for validation on startup, 3) Configure logging based on --verbose flag, 4) Call BoardGenerator and print results with proper exit codes. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Main function must have cyclomatic complexity <= 8; separate argument parsing from execution logic; extract setup_logging() helper; no function exceeds 25 lines; use consistent exit code constants (0=success, 1=user error, 2=system error). [CODE SMELLS] No bare sys.exit() calls without logging; argument help text must be complete and accurate; no duplicate argument definitions; consistent error message format; run pylint/flake8 with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] CLI is thin layer - delegates to modules; follows Unix conventions (exit codes, stderr for errors, stdout for output); main() function is testable (accepts args parameter); no business logic in CLI module; consistent with argparse best practices. [SECURITY] Validate --name input length and characters before API call; --description sanitized for special characters; never echo credentials even with --verbose; exit gracefully on keyboard interrupt; no sensitive data in error messages or stack traces shown to user. [PERFORMANCE] Lazy import of heavy modules; fail fast on missing credentials before loading templates; --dry-run must not import unnecessary modules; minimal startup time for --help. [TESTING] Unit tests required: test argument parsing for all flags; test --help output; test missing required arguments; test --dry-run does not call API; test --setup invokes credential flow; test exit codes for success/failure; test keyboard interrupt handling; all tests must pass.

title: TRELLO-005a: Implement credential setup and validation
description: Create src/credentials.py with interactive credential setup and validation. Features: 1) Check if .env file exists with TRELLO_API_KEY and TRELLO_TOKEN, 2) If missing, display setup instructions with URLs (https://trello.com/power-ups/admin for API key, token generation link), 3) Interactive prompt asking user to enter API key and token, 4) Validate credentials by making test API call to Trello, 5) Save validated credentials to .env file, 6) Provide clear error messages for invalid credentials. Functions: check_credentials(), prompt_for_credentials(), validate_credentials(api_key, token), save_credentials(api_key, token). IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Implement credential checking logic with clear return types, 2) Add interactive prompts with getpass for secure input, 3) Add API validation call using minimal permissions endpoint, 4) Implement .env file writing with restrictive permissions (600). QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Each function must have single responsibility; cyclomatic complexity <= 5 per function; no function exceeds 20 lines; extract validation logic from I/O logic; use constants for URLs and messages. [CODE SMELLS] No credentials in error messages or logs; no hardcoded file paths (use pathlib); consistent return types (use Optional or Result pattern); all functions have docstrings and type hints; run pylint/flake8 with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] Pure functions where possible; credential operations isolated from business logic; follows 12-factor app config principles; no global state for credentials; dependency injection for file operations (testability). [SECURITY] CRITICAL - Use getpass.getpass() for credential input (no echo); set .env file permissions to 600 (owner read/write only); validate credentials before saving (prevent storing invalid tokens); never log credentials at any level; sanitize credential format before API call; timeout on validation request (10s max); clear credentials from memory after use where possible. [PERFORMANCE] Single validation API call only; fail fast on invalid format before network call; no redundant file reads; cache check result for session duration. [TESTING] Unit tests required: test check_credentials with missing file; test check_credentials with invalid format; test prompt mocking with unittest.mock; test save_credentials creates file with correct permissions; test validation with mocked API responses (success/failure); security test - verify credentials not in any log output; all tests must pass.

title: TRELLO-006: Add unit tests with mocked API
description: Create comprehensive test suite in tests/ directory. Test files: test_trello_client.py, test_templates.py, test_board_generator.py, test_credentials.py, test_cli.py. Use pytest with responses/unittest.mock for API mocking. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Create conftest.py with shared fixtures, 2) Write tests for each module achieving minimum coverage targets, 3) Add integration test for full workflow with mocked API, 4) Configure pytest.ini with coverage requirements. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Test functions follow Arrange-Act-Assert pattern; no test exceeds 30 lines; extract common setup to fixtures; eliminate duplicate mock configurations; use parametrize for similar test cases; test file structure mirrors src/ structure. [CODE SMELLS] No skipped tests without documented reason; no sleep() calls in tests; no hardcoded test data that duplicates production constants; assert messages explain failures; no broad exception catching in tests; run pylint on test files with zero errors. [ARCHITECTURE] Tests are isolated - no shared state between tests; fixtures use appropriate scope (function/module/session); mocks verify both calls and arguments; test naming convention: test_<unit>_<scenario>_<expected>; integration tests clearly separated from unit tests. [SECURITY] Test credential handling security (no logging); test input validation edge cases; test error messages do not leak sensitive data; test timeout behavior; test that dry-run makes zero network calls (verify with mock call counts). [PERFORMANCE] Test suite completes in under 30 seconds; no network calls in unit tests (all mocked); use pytest-xdist for parallel execution if needed; fixtures minimize setup overhead. [TESTING] META - Coverage requirements: overall >= 85%; trello_client.py >= 90%; board_generator.py >= 90%; credentials.py >= 95% (security critical); CLI >= 80%; all tests must pass; pytest --cov-fail-under=85 must succeed.

title: TRELLO-007: Document setup and usage in README
description: Update README.md with comprehensive documentation. Include: 1) Project overview and purpose, 2) Prerequisites (Python 3.9+, Trello account), 3) Getting Trello API credentials with step-by-step instructions, 4) Installation steps (clone, pip install, .env setup), 5) Usage examples (basic, with description, dry-run, --setup for credentials), 6) Template customization guide, 7) Troubleshooting common issues, 8) Contributing guidelines. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Write clear setup instructions with exact commands, 2) Add usage examples with expected output, 3) Document credential setup process with screenshots/links, 4) Add troubleshooting section for common errors. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] README sections follow logical order; no duplicate information; code examples are copy-paste ready; use consistent formatting (headers, code blocks, lists); maximum 500 lines - link to separate docs for detailed topics. [CODE SMELLS] No broken links; no outdated version numbers; no placeholder text (TBD, TODO); all code examples tested and working; spelling and grammar checked; consistent terminology throughout. [ARCHITECTURE] Documentation matches implemented behavior exactly; CLI help text and README are consistent; follows standard README conventions (badges, table of contents for long docs); links to related resources (Trello API docs). [SECURITY] Credential setup instructions emphasize security (never commit .env); document .gitignore requirements; warn about token permissions and scope; no real API keys/tokens in examples (use obvious placeholders like 'your_api_key_here'). [PERFORMANCE] N/A for documentation. [TESTING] Verification required: fresh clone + follow README produces working setup; all code examples execute successfully; --help output matches documented arguments; common error scenarios documented with solutions; have another person follow setup instructions to verify clarity.

title: TRELLO-008: Create run.sh with excellent UX and venv management
description: Create run.sh as single-command entry point with professional UX. Features: 1) Auto-detect and create venv if missing, 2) Activate venv within subshell, 3) Install dependencies if needed, 4) Run application with passed arguments, 5) Deactivate venv on exit (success or failure), 6) Colored progress output with spinners, 7) Prerequisites check (Python 3.9+), 8) Secure credential prompting via .env check. IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Implement with set -euo pipefail and trap handlers, 2) Add color output functions with TTY detection, 3) Check Python version before venv creation, 4) Use pip -q for quiet installs with progress indication, 5) Pass through all CLI arguments to application, 6) Ensure cleanup runs on EXIT/INT/TERM signals. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] Functions for each responsibility (check_python, setup_venv, install_deps, run_app); no function exceeds 20 lines; use readonly for constants; local variables in all functions; consistent naming convention (snake_case). [CODE SMELLS] No unquoted variables; use [[ ]] over [ ]; no useless cat; no cd without error handling; shellcheck passes with zero warnings; no hardcoded paths (use dirname). [ARCHITECTURE] Script works from any directory via SCRIPT_DIR detection; no assumptions about current directory; all paths relative to script location; follows Unix conventions (stdout for output, stderr for errors, meaningful exit codes). [SECURITY] Never echo credentials; warn if .env is world-readable; no eval or unvalidated input expansion; validate Python path before execution; no secrets in process list (use env vars not args for credentials). [PERFORMANCE] Skip venv creation if exists; skip pip install if deps unchanged (check requirements.txt mtime vs installed marker); lazy dependency checks; fast --help path. [TESTING] Manual verification: fresh clone + ./run.sh works; ./run.sh --help shows help fast; ./run.sh --dry-run works without credentials; Ctrl+C cleanly exits; works on macOS and Linux.

title: TRELLO-009: Create Makefile for development workflows
description: Create Makefile with standard development targets for consistent developer experience. Targets: help (default, show available commands), install (setup venv and deps), test (run pytest), lint (run linters), format (auto-format code), clean (remove artifacts), run (alias for ./run.sh). IMPLEMENTATION STEPS: 1) Use .PHONY for non-file targets, 2) Auto-generate help from comments, 3) Use consistent venv activation pattern, 4) Integrate with run.sh for run target. QUALITY GATES - Task incomplete until all pass: [REFACTORING] One target per concern; use variables for repeated paths; consistent indentation (tabs for recipes). [CODE SMELLS] No hardcoded paths; help text for all targets; .PHONY declarations. [ARCHITECTURE] Makefile works standalone; compatible with CI/CD. [SECURITY] No credentials in Makefile; use .env for secrets. [TESTING] All targets execute without error on fresh clone.
